title: Music in Keen Dreams?
content:
Soem idiot on another forum is telling me that KEen Dreams has music.

Now of the three various copies of KD that I've d/led and used, none of them have had music.

I'm not crazy, am I?~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Music in Keen Dreams?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]probably they don't have even the code for music written in there,[hr][/quote]

Actually I wouldn't at all be surprised if the music code is in fact still/already in there.
We know Bobby Prince finished at least one song for Keen Dreams, and another fact is that the in-game menu still claims there is background music.

If there was music code in the game, or even just part of it, if they really removed it, they probably would've removed that music option in the menu as well, since that should be a lot less work compared, and it's confusing.
Removing that code would probably not make the game a whole lot smaller, compared to removing all the music that was planned.

Then there's the option you're talking about, that there never was any music code to begin with, at least nothing complete integrated into the rest of the game, but would Bobby Prince have started composing if that was the case?
From what I remember the decision to remove the music came pretty late in development.
It wasn't id's idea either... so my guess is there was already code in KD, but of course it's just conjecture.Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Music in Keen Dreams?
content:
The version of Keen Dreams I have does access port 0x388, the Adlib soundcard port, according to the output when I dissassembled the EXE.Groeten van Frenkel
Visit [url=http://www.sfprod.cjb.net]The Official S&F Prod. Homepage[/url]

title: Re: Music in Keen Dreams?
content:
The version of Keen Dreams I have does access port 0x388, the Adlib soundcard port

That would presumably be because you have the Adlib sound effects still switched on [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

The IMF player would only end up as a hundred bytes or so of assembly code, so it probably wasn't worth the effort to remove it. All we have to do now is figure out whether the game still looks for the music files on disk, and if so it would be pretty straightforward to add songs back into KD.

Removing the text about there being no music and making the on/off button work could also be done.

Softdisk never changed the AUDIO. file from the original version.

title: Re: Music in Keen Dreams?
content:
Hmmm, true -- there might well be the code written for music player, after all. I didn't remember at the moment of writing that the music was removed in some later phase, yeah. And probably Bobby could've started producing music even if they hadn't any code written for the player, since it's quite separate process.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Future keen dreams music
content:
I think I can start working on it now right now.

BING!!

ME: who are you?

FUTURE ME: Im you from the future.

ME: Hey its me from the future, hows it going?

FUTURE ME: Well, heres the source code for commander keen, the secret to life and the keen dreams MOD you wanted.

ME: anything else.

FUTURE ME: Nope.

ME: What about the future plans for the time machine?

FUTURE ME: No!

ME: Why not?

FUTURE ME: You dont need it now.

ME: Yeah I.....why is your arm missing?

FUTURE ME: I lost it in a explosion, it was sent to another time and space.

ME: What!?

FUTURE ME: I later found it with a traveling circus, its a freak show act.

ME: Whats it called?

FUTURE ME: THE ZOMBIES ARM!!

FUTURE ME: I have to get going now and Remember, dont build a time machine...

BING!!

ME: Cool I have the source code for commander keen.

BANG!

ME: I'VE been shot!!!.

THE TERMINATOR: Apocalypse gohan, you must be terminated so the humans will be unable to buld a time machine to send someone back in time to protect Sarah Connor.

ME: Wait no I.....sh..

BANG!

BANG!

BANG!

ME: ...it!

BANG!

THE TERMINATOR: You have been terminated!!

THE TERMINATOR: Now to set out on my next mission, to terminate Sarah Connor and rest of the human resistance in the past!

ME: I'll be back...

BANG!

THE TERMINATOR: No, I say that.

title: Re: Future keen dreams music
content: Up until "I've been shot", at which point you took it too far, that was a rather amusing roleplay.

title: Re: music
content:
"I doubt there's ever going to be a pogo mod for KD, short of the source code being released. Unlike the music, I'm pretty sure the pogo stick wasn't even implemented when they released Dreams, so it's not like it's sitting locked away and only requires a simple patch to activate the code."
Yes, as do I, but it wasn't me who said there is a mod -- Apocalypse Gohan said that: "... but is there a mod for keen dreams that gives keen the pogo stick from the other games."
I frankly don't believe it, however. We would've heard about it by now, unless it's made by some of his friends who doesn't want it to be uploaded.
